tweets.html:
This Sunday's Breaking Bad. #goodlord
*Next* Sunday's Breaking Bad. #jesuschrist

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) August 27, 2011

Like phoning them more and remembering their birthday? RT @guardianTV: BBC1 'to do more for older viewers' http://t.co/LZbTAbH

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) August 27, 2011

Latest weekend forecast: 36 hours of unprecedented sucking and blowing, followed by a new episode of Entourage.

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) August 27, 2011

@jeffjarvis it's so considerate of the Libyans to put the revolution on hold so CNN could cover Irene

— Tan Homsi (@tanhomsi) August 27, 2011

Let's face it: the real stars of this hurricane are those oversized red sweatshirts on CNN. #irene #hurricane

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) August 27, 2011

Vermont didn't have earthquakes and hurricanes before Kim Kardashian was married. Just saying.

— Tom Bodett (@TomBodett) August 27, 2011

Mom watching TV: "This is like a pledge week times 1000. They're just standing there, saying the same thing over and over."

— Lizzie O'Leary (@lizzieohreally) August 27, 2011

CNN loves the heck out of their touchscreens, boy howdy.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

Meanwhile, on The Weather Channel, Jeff and Mike hold the Windbreaker Smackdown!

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

I'd be impressed if cable news nets/Weather Channel put up alerts that said storm was downgraded with same vigor they hyped its potential

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) August 27, 2011

Quick turn on the news! This guy on an NC Beach just reported that sand blowing into your face at high speed is painful.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) August 27, 2011

Eric in Virginia Beach: "The place where I am, I should not be, really. Back to you, Mike."

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

Yelling over the wind is making every hurricane reporter sound like Larry David.

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) August 27, 2011

CNN people just *love* saying "astronomically high tide." Bet we'll hear "astronomically high" in their political reporting soon.

— Jeff Jarvis (@jeffjarvis) August 27, 2011

@carr2n Weather Channel reporting @brianstelter is putting tweets into bottles, throwing them into astronomically high tide.

— Jeff Jarvis (@jeffjarvis) August 27, 2011

Idiots drive by and wave as TWC Eric talks about idiots driving around. They wave, oblivious, as he explains that they're selfish dopes.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

Watching the ads during Irene coverage, I'm reminded of what the average age for a cable news viewer is. #IveFallenAndICantGetUp

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) August 27, 2011

"It's beautifully structured!" coos @WeatherChannel guy about radar image of #Irene. "Great banding going on here!" #stormporn

— Don Van Natta Jr. (@DVNJr) August 27, 2011

My favorite part of CNN's hurricane coverage is the thinly-veiled glee.

— Jeff B. Davis (@JeffBryanDavis) August 27, 2011

Oh, dear, full frontal nudity on The Weather Channel.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

Yup, this is a guy mooning a weather channel reporter. "this is just depressing " http://t.co/MeXA2A2

— Alex Weprin (@alexweprin) August 27, 2011

For real. "Man missing. Last seen doing this." MT @kimsnarks @nprmonkeysee What a legacy that guy's leaving behind. Last photo of him alive.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

...and that, officially, was a penis on The Weather Channel. Stay classy, Virginia Beach. #HRVA #Irene

— John Cachero (@johncachero) August 27, 2011

RT @johncachero: ..and that, officially, was a penis on The Weather Channel. Stay classy, Virginia Beach. #HRVA #Irene // True weather porn!

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) August 27, 2011

Eric in Virginia Beach is reporting high winds, driving rain, and a 10 percent chance of streakers.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

That Hurricane streaker made today the 1st time in TV history the Weather Channel showed more dicks than C-Span.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) August 27, 2011

Graphic on CNN: "Piers Take A Beating From Irene." He must have hacked her phone.

— Josh A. Cagan (@joshacagan) August 27, 2011

The real Dawson's Creek is flooded.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) August 27, 2011

Hurricane Irene is the worst thing to happen to the New Jersey shore since... oh, forget it

— Joe DeVito (@JoeDeVitoComedy) August 27, 2011

Also, Hitler's already dead. Can someone inform Doctor Who that he's wasting his time?

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) August 27, 2011

How sexy is Gwyneth Paltrow? Well, I just mistook her for David Hyde Pierce: http://t.co/dcv7r7H

— Patrick Walsh (@thepatrickwalsh) August 27, 2011

Jim Rash aka Dean Pelton now has a goatee on #Community. Wonder how this will effect the quality of the show. @sepinwall @HitFixDaniel

— Jamiesen Borak (@that_darn_jbo) August 27, 2011

Every time The Weather Channel cuts to a shot of Mike Seidel on Nags Head, it looks like they're showing the only known photo of Bigfoot.

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) August 27, 2011

Breaking: chances of Anderson Cooper wearing a totally cute windbreaker today now 100%

— jason (@Jason) August 27, 2011

#Irene please do not take my power until after #DoctorWho.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) August 27, 2011

Glenn Beck says the hurricane is "God reminding you... you're not in control." GLENN BECK is God reminding us we're not in control.

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) August 27, 2011

Dear Looters: You even touch my Deluxe Edition Meet Me In St. Louis DVD, I will kill you. You hear me? I will hunt you down

— Mo Rocca (@MoRocca) August 27, 2011

MD Gov. O'Malley to @wolfblitzercnn: "tell Chris (Lawrence) to get the hell out of that water"

— Mark Joyella (@standupkid) August 27, 2011

I'd love to give you my thoughts on last night's #Torchwood, but I'll be damned if I have a clue what's going on at this point.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 27, 2011

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Temple suspiciously unavailable for comment. RT @TVGuide: Former Shirley Temple rival child star Sybil Jason has died http://t.co/Pj6A6Gh

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) August 27, 2011

I appreciate all the thoughts, prayers, and wishes being sent my way because of #Irene, but I really wish you'd send The Tardis instead.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) August 27, 2011

Weird when TV anchors keep addressing people who may have lost power. #BecauseVeryFewWatchWithBatteries

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) August 27, 2011

Brian Williams on MSNBC. I feel like I should put on a suit. Just not right to watch BW in a salsa-stained t-shirt.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) August 27, 2011

Hurricane Irene. BBC reporter : Can you describe the conditions? British Tourist : Windy. #drama

— Joanna Judge (@AnAbsintheFairy) August 27, 2011

Eric has heroically reported all day from Virginia Beach through rain, wind and unwelcome nudity. #weatherheroes

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 27, 2011

Gotta love the undocile subjects driving through and thus mocking CNN's heroic weather remotes.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) August 27, 2011

That said, here's hoping Irene's big NYC finale is as disappointing and uneventful at the season finale of The Killing.

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) August 28, 2011

Easiest Hurricane Irene TV reporting job: covering "the social media angle." #DontHaveToWearARaincoat

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) August 28, 2011

Pretty sure #irene has now been on CNN longer than Parker/Spitzer was.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) August 28, 2011

My TV is filled with images of a sloppy, ugly mess. And that's just the Lions preseason game. #irene

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) August 28, 2011

You're a 26-yr-old adult male. Grow the fuck up. RT @FrankieMuniz: A rusty nail sliced into my thumb today. I need a tetanus shot. Help me.

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) August 28, 2011

@EliBraden Die.

— Frankie Muniz (@frankiemuniz) August 28, 2011

5 #NYC Airports closed. Subways shut down. We are one Kurt Russell short of "Escape From New York" #HurricaneIrene

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) August 28, 2011

Had we just sacrificed the #JerseyShore gang to the Gods earlier this week maybe none of this shit would be happening right now.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) August 28, 2011

All showrunners can unite behind this sentiment. RT @shondarhimes: Hope everyone in Irene's path is able to stay safe!!!

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) August 28, 2011

The least MSNBC could do is keep in their first string. We got the serious B team up in this biz for prime Irene time. #bringbackbriandubs

— Michelle Biloon (@biloon) August 28, 2011

All night I've been on the street in a raincoat talking into a microphone just to screw with the neighbors... #Irene

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) August 28, 2011

Stocking up on food so I don't have to leave the house when the eye of the hurricane tweets hit.

— Robin McCauley Lynch (@RobinMcCauley) August 28, 2011

This episode of Louie is already excellent, but even better when drunk & ready for death by either hurricane or hurricane-disappointment.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) August 28, 2011

If you aren't watching Bloomberg's press conference right now, you are missing out on some awesome monotone grumpy hilarity.

— Michelle Biloon (@biloon) August 28, 2011

Directing TV is like picking up a girls at last call. There's lot's of competition and you generally hate the end result.

— Dan Sackheim (@DanSackheim) August 28, 2011

If you're looking for less intense coverage of Irene, I recommend the iPhone weather app.

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) August 28, 2011

These 8 months old DVR recordings of the new 90210 aren't going to just watch themselves.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) August 28, 2011

I just don't want #irene to hit us so hard that Sean Penn shows up.

— Adam Bonin (@adambonin) August 28, 2011

Dear Weathermen, I will still believe you, even if you are indoors.

— Eugene Mirman (@EugeneMirman) August 28, 2011

I switch back to FOX. Geraldo Rivera is stripped to the waist, boot polish smeared over his face and chest, yelling at film of a subway car.

— Henry James (@thishenryjames) August 28, 2011

If you go to sleep now, you'll miss out on watching that storm track graphic that's been on for a week. Totally up to you.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) August 28, 2011

Local weatherguy just had a coughing fit on live tv. This is why Philly is the realest.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 28, 2011

This wall to wall hurricane coverage has me fired up for news coverage that will accompany our first zombie attack.

— Medium Happy (@jdubs88) August 28, 2011

Be mindful of the unspoken rule of disaster coverage on TV: If it's really serious, they would forego the commercials.

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) August 28, 2011

It's impossible to step outside in New York right now and not feel like a CNN reporter. #irene #hurricane

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) August 28, 2011

At 3:10 am ET, CNN reporter Chris Lawrence in Maryland admits on air storm not as bad as expected. Expect him to be fired immediately.

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) August 28, 2011

Bright side to #Irene: @andersoncooper won't have to fly to a crisis. Just grab a black T-shirt, hip waders, go downstairs. Maybe a snorkel.

— Bob Harris (@bobharrisdotcom) August 28, 2011

View from outside NYC: online #irene news = so far not terrible; TV news = MY GOD THERE'S WATER AT MY ANKLES.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) August 28, 2011

There are literally dudes calmly strolling in short sleeve shirts in the background while a CNN anchor mimes out a dramatic wind struggle.

— Andrew Kueneman 🇺🇸 (@andrewkueneman) August 28, 2011

Now that Hurricane Irene has been downgraded to a tropical storm, time's running out for newscasters to completely lose their shit.

— Steven Santos (@stevensantos) August 28, 2011

Full marks to the cable news net that drops nonstop storm coverage first. Shots of drunk guys bodyboarding in streets are really gripping.

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) August 28, 2011

CNN would have a lot fewer technical problems with remotes if reporters would step out of driving rain and wind. #irene #stormporn #stupid

— James O'Byrne (@jamesobyrne) August 28, 2011
